summary: "Still Alice" is a 2014 drama film about a linguistics professor, Alice Howland (Julianne Moore), who is diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease at 50. The movie is based on a book by Lisa Genova. Moore, the directors, and the producers worked hard to make the film authentic. Shot in New York with a $4 million budget, it premiered in Toronto in 2014. Despite being leaked online, it was well-received, making over $43 million globally. Moore won many awards, including an Oscar, which she dedicated to the director who passed away from ALS.
title: Still Alice
